deduplication: name=note-NTFS-Dedup Supported only on Windows Server SKUs. However, partitions deduplicated on Server can be used on Client.[48]

encryption: name=note-77 HFS+ does not actually encrypt files: to implement FileVault, OS X creates an HFS+ filesystem in a sparse, encrypted disk image that is automatically mounted over the home directory when the user logs in.
name=note-50 Reiser4 supports transparent compression and encryption with the cryptcompress plugin which is the default file handler in version 4.1.

VxFS,name=note-70 VxFS provides an optional feature called Storage Checkpoints" which allows for advanced file system snapshots.

encryption: name=zfscrypt Applies to proprietary ZFS release 30 and ZFS On Linux. Encryption support is not yet available in all OpenZFS ports.[53][54][55]

deduplication: name=note-79Some file system creation implementations reuse block references and support deduplication this way. This is not supported by the standard, but usually works well due to the file system's read-only nature.
